Experience - Recreational Coordinator

Through working in Walt Disney World company as Recreational Coordinator, I have gained a remarkable experiences that would separate me from other candidates.

1

Communication/Team Work

As part of Disney recreation, you must work as a team. As a coordinator, you are responsible for manage staffing, daily operational tasks (i.e. checking pool chemical, emergency incidents), and projects (assigned by leaders). In order to achieve your responsibilities, you must communicate with your team, and work together to have a successful and effcient daily operation.

2

Critical Thinking

In case of emergency and conflicts, you must use your critical thinking skills in order to asses the situation and prevent further conflicts or injuries when you are in charge of the recreation team. I have managed multiple incidents (CPR, bleed control, guests' conflict/fighting) by making a judgement calls to respond in each scenario. I have aquired Valor Award for saving a guests' life

3

Problem Solving

I was blessed enough to be able to face certain problems and be able to solve it within on my own or simply by asking fellow helpful cast members hands. Learned not to afraid to ask for helping hand when needed and tackle the problem and solve as a team.

4

Documentation

Proper Documentation goes a long way. However, within the role, I have aquired the importance of proper Documentation. As part of the team, we utilize microsoft SharePoint tool to manage all of a files. I have learned to properly manage the documents so that the others can manage thousands of documents efficiently.
